qas.question: Who was the first reigning monarch from Britain to set foot in Spain?

answers.text: acknowledge the contribution of Irish regiments to the South African war

context: <a0_0><b14_0>Victoria<b14_0/><a0_0/> visited <a9_0>mainland Europe<a9_0/> regularly for holidays. In <a1_0><b15_0>1889<b15_0/><a1_0/>, during a stay in <a5_0>Biarritz<a5_0/>, she became the first reigning monarch from Britain to <a10_0>set foot in Spain<a10_0/> when she crossed the border for a brief visit. By April <a2_0><a4_0><b16_0><b18_0>1900<b18_0/><b16_0/><a4_0/><a2_0/>, <a12_0>the <a6_0>Boer War<a12_0/><a6_0/> was so unpopular in mainland Europe that her annual trip to France seemed inadvisable. Instead, the Queen went to <a3_0><a7_0><b17_0>Ireland<b17_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/> for the first time since 1861, in part to <a11_0>acknowledge the contribution of Irish regiments to the South African war<a11_0/>. In July, <a8_0><a13_0>her second son Alfred<a8_0/> ("Affie") died<a13_0/>; "Oh, God! My poor darling Affie gone too", she wrote in her journal. "It is a horrible year, nothing but sadness & horrors of one kind & another."
